resources.string: All You Need In One Place

The GPA calculator is just to help you predict your GPA for the semester depending on your own assessment of yourself. i.e How focussed you are, the marks you are getting in your quizzes and assignments and the marks you predict to get in your final exam for the semester. 

 Each course is represented by the numbers 1 - 10. Provide the assessments of each course (quizzes, exercises, assignments, attendance, etc) all summing up to 40 (40\% of the total marks). Input the Exam score for each course which makes up 60\% of the total scores Choose the appropriate credit hours for each course (0 - 4) and hit the Calculate button to calculate your GPA for the Semester 

 There is a maximum of 10 courses, and a maximum of 4 credits for each. If your courses aren't up to 10, leave the rest unfilled. 

 The results are based on University of Cape Coast (UCC) grading system. 

 Grading Scale 
 The University uses letter grades and corresponding numerical weightings which reflect the quality of performance. Total raw scores (combination of continuous assessment and end-of-semester examination) are converted according to the following scheme\:

Degree Classification
 Undergraduate degree programmes are classified according to the candidateâ€™s Cumulative Grade Point Average [CGPA]. The classifications are as follows:

Getting started

 Register Course
 Click REGISTER COURSES button > [Enter course name in Course Name field] > ADD COURSE button 

 Edit or Delete Course
 Long press on course > EDIT(if you want to change course name) or DELETE(if you want to clear off course) or CANCEL(exit Choose Action dialog)
 (In Editing mode) > Type new name > SAVE
 
 Delete All registered courses
 Click Clear Courses icon on Toolbar > CONFIRM
 
 Create new schedule
 Click NEW SCHEDULE button > [Select course from Courses Drop down list] > [Enter classroom or venue in Classroom field] > [Type in lecture's name in Lecturer field] > [Beginning and End of lecture times (Starts, Ends)] > [Select day for lecture from Days drop down list] > SAVE button
 
 Edit or Delete Schedule
 Long press on lecture > EDIT(if you want to edit schedule) or DELETE(if you want to clear schedule) or CANCEL(exit Choose Action dialog).
 (In Editing mode) > Make all necessary changes > SAVE
 
 Delete All Schedules
 Click Reset Timetable icon on Toolbar > CONFIRM
 
Yellow for Lecture, Green for Personal
